comment: She teaches APUSH and AP gov at North Paulding now and she is still horrible. She made the class much harder than other AP classes and assigned a bunch of busy work that made it difficult to manage enough time to study for the tests. Stay away.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: doesn't care about the students. Requires document readings (atleast 5) during the semester. She's not very organized, ended up  losing one of mine and took points off for it.

I have to say she is hands down the worst teacher I've had at Kennesaw thus far.  Boring powerpoint lectures. I would read for reading quizzes and still fail them. Tests are over a lot of material and very detailed for a survey course, some of the hardest I've had.

Simply dreadful. Useless lectures, inaccurate, poor spelling skills, unable to intelligently converse in her area of study. KSU has many great instructors, and many poor ones, C Stanley tops my all time list of the bad. Phone-it-in teaching at best, dangerously unqualified at worst. Stay away.

This is revisionist history to the hilt. She is not interested in accuracy nor professionalism. She has the uncanny ability to take an interesting subject and make it as boring. The amount of work for a survey course is ridiculous.
She makes more mistakes in her lectures than any Prof should be allowed to.  Her tests are terrible, the questions are very poorly worded.  A very bad teacher.  Stay away
Don't take her! She gives 10 pop quizzes in the semester and her tests are awful. She gives study guides, but there is so much information it is hard to study.
